0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	135	  Promoter-Reporter Gene Assays Plasmids pDelDel, pDelIns, pInsDel, pInsIns, p12Ins, and p12Del carrying the firefly luciferase open reading frame under the control of different PRNP promoter alleles were cotransfected into two different bovine cell lines, PT and KOP, with the pRL-TK normalization vector (Fig.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	136	 Each assay was carried out in triplicates at 6 (PT) or 5 (KOP) separate weeks (nPT = 18 and nKOP = 15).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	137	 Every week, cells were also transfected with the pGL3-Control vector for standardization of these six or five passages.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	138	 The activity of firefly luciferase compared with that of Renilla luciferase reflected the promoter activity.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	139	 The mean values of each test construct are indicated in Fig.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	140	In both cell lines, the p12Ins vector yielded a significantly higher expression level than the p12Del vector (p  <  0.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	141	 The order of expression levels of the longer reporter gene constructs in PT cells was as follows: pDelDel, pDelIns, pInsDel, pInsIns.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	142	 In KOP cells, the order was as follows: pDelIns, pDelDel, pInsDel, pInsIns.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	143	 In both cell lines, the pDelDel vector yielded significantly higher expression levels than the pInsIns vector (pKOP  <  0.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Thus, the effect of the isolated 12-bp indel polymorphism in the shorter reporter gene constructs p12Ins and p12Del was reversed in the longer reporter gene constructs pInsIns and pDelDel.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	145	 The pInsDel and pDelIns constructs displayed inconsistent expression levels in the two cell lines.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	146	 However, it must be kept in mind that pDelIns is a very rare haplotype and that pInsDel has not yet been found in an animal at all, not in the previous studies (1) or in the present qRT-PCR study (see below).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	147	View larger version (36K):    FIGURE 4.

0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	154	  Promoter-Reporter Gene Assays with Overexpression of Specific Transcription Factors We transfected the PT and KOP cell lines with the pDelDel, pDelIns, pInsDel, pInsIns, p12Ins, and p12Del plasmids, similar to the initial reporter gene assays.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	155	 In addition to the reporter gene constructs, the transcription factor-expressing plasmids pRP58 and pRSV/SP1 were added to some wells.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	156	 This study was performed in triplicates at 3 (PT) or 2 (KOP) separate weeks (nPT = 9 and nKOP = 6) (supplemental Fig.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	157	The addition of pRSV/SP1 to the p12Ins and p12Del vectors resulted in elevated luciferase expression levels with both constructs in PT cells, but only with p12Del in KOP cells (PT, pp12Ins = 0.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	158	 In PT cells, the increase in expression was also much more pronounced with p12Del than with p12Ins.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	159	 The p12Del reporter gene construct includes three putative SP1-binding sites (positions  to 98 to  to 93, +351 to +356, and +901 to +906).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	160	 In addition to these three SP1-binding sites, the p12Ins vector harbors an additional one within the 12-bp insertion at position +300.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	161	In the long constructs, the overexpression of SP1 consistently led to slightly increased luciferase expression if the 23-bp deletion was present at position  to 1594, regardless of whether the 12-bp indel polymorphism with the SP1 site was present or not.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	162	 However, in three of four assays with the 23-bp insertion at position  to 1594, the overexpression of SP1 had no significant effect on luciferase expression.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	163	 SP1 overexpression also led to an increase in reporter gene expression with pInsIns in the PT cell line.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	164	 Thus, the presence of the 23-bp insertion in the 5'-flanking sequence seemed to reduce the SP1-induced activation of the PRNP promoter.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	165	 The overexpression of recombinant RP58 also increased luciferase expression in all four constructs with the 23-bp deletion at position  to 1594, whereas the expression level did not change significantly in all four constructs with the 23-bp insertion.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	166	qRT-PCR Experiments We collected 96 bovine tissue samples from each the brain stem, intestinal lymph nodes, spleen, and liver.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	167	 RNA was isolated and used for qRT-PCR experiments measuring the absolute transcript quantities of the PRNP and GAPDH genes by the standard curve method.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	168	 A relative quantification was performed by dividing the PRNP expression level by the GAPDH expression level.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	169	 DNA from the same tissue samples was used for genotyping with regard to the 23- and 12-bp indel polymorphisms.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	170	 Five different genotypes were identified: 23del:12del (n = 27 to 30), 23del:12het (n = 5 to 6), 23het:12het (n = 39 to 41), 23het:12ins (n = 6 to 7), and 23ins:12ins (n = 15 to 16).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	171	 The results from qRT-PCR were evaluated with respect to these five genotype groups.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	172	The expression levels of the four different tissues differed widely.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	173	 The highest PRNP mRNA expression levels were encountered in the brain, followed by the spleen, liver, and intestinal lymph nodes.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	174	 Within these tissue groups, the brain stem, spleen, and liver showed no significant differences in mean expression levels with respect to the genotypes.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	175	 In lymph node samples, the 23het:12ins expression levels were lower than the 23del:12del, 23del:12het, and 23het:12het expression levels (supplemental Fig.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	176	 The raw data were not in a normal distribution.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	177	 Often, single animals showed dramatic variations relative to the average.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	178	 Intestinal lymph node expression levels of the most common genotypes are shown in Fig.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	179	 The liver expression levels were an exception; here, the raw data fit better to a normal distribution, and smaller standard errors were observed compared with the other tissues.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	180	 The complete qRT-PCR data from all tissues are shown in supplemental Fig.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	181	The mutations  to 1980TC,  to 1594indel23bp,  to 85GT, +300indel 12bp, +571AG, and +709AG were preselected for further experiments by an in silico analysis of transcription factor-binding sites.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	182	 Allelic variants at these six potential transcription factor-binding sites differ with respect to the consensus binding sites, and the involved transcription factors are themselves expressed in relevant tissues for BSE pathogenesis.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	183	 These putative transcription factors are SP1, AP2, RP58, NEUROG1, EGR4, and POZ.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	184	 SP1 is a ubiquitous protein and is involved in the regulation of many promoters (24).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	185	 AP2 plays a role in tissues of ectodermal origin (25).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	186	 RP58 was named according to its function and is expressed mainly in the brain (26, 27).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	187	 It includes a POZ domain, which has been described as an interactor with SP1.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	188	 It has been suggested that the POZ domain represses transcription by interfering with the DNA-binding activity of SP1 (28).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	189	 EGR4 (also called nerve growth factor-induced clone C) is like neurogenin-1, a protein that is most likely involved in brain function (29, 30).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	190	 The transcription factor POZ protein BCL6 plays a role in B-cell differentiation and represses transcription, as does RP58 (31).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	191	View larger version (13K):    FIGURE 5.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	192	 Expression levels of PRNP in cattle intestinal lymph nodes with different PRNP promoter genotypes.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	193	 RNA was isolated from 96 bovine tissue samples.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	194	 Transcript quantities were analyzed by qRT-PCR.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	195	 Absolute PRNP and GAPDH expression levels were determined by the standard curve method.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	196	 The relative expression levels of PRNP normalized to bovine GAPDH (PRNP/GAPDH) are shown for all animals with the common genotypes 23ins:12ins, 23het:12het, and 23del:12del.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	197	 The mean values of each genotype group are indicated by horizontal lines.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	198	  All six transcription factors were studied by EMSAs.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	199	 All oligonucleotide probes with the exception of the two allelic variants of the AP2-binding site produced band shifts.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	200	 In the case of the two indel polymorphisms, the observed band shifts differed between allelic PRNP promoter variants.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	201	 The specificity of the DNA-protein interaction was checked by competition with unlabeled probes.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	202	 In the case of SP1, the identity of the shifted band from the nuclear brain extract was further corroborated by a positive control experiment using purified recombinant SP1.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	203	 The results of the RP58 EMSA suggest that RP58 had a higher affinity for the 23-bp insertion allele.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	204	 The weak affinity of RP58 for the 23-bp deletion allele is not surprising, as the RP58-binding site is duplicated with just one mismatch outside the indel polymorphism.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	205	Following the initial evidence from the EMSA experiments, we created reporter gene constructs with these polymorphisms in every possible combination.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	206	 The 12-bp indel polymorphism in intron 1 was deliberately included in the analysis, as it has previously been shown that intron 1 elements are necessary for bovine PRNP promoter activity (17).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	207	 Our reporter gene assays revealed an influence of the indel polymorphisms on PRNP transcription rates.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	208	 Surprisingly, in a short construct, the 12-bp insertion alone resulted in an increased expression level, whereas in the long construct in combination with the 23-bp insertion, the 12-bp insertion caused a decreased expression level.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	209	 These findings are compatible with a model in which RP58 binds to the 5'-flanking sequence of the PRNP gene and represses PRNP promoter activity by an interaction with SP1 bound within intron 1, similar to known RP58-SP1 interactions in other promoters (28).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	210	RP58 seems to be a logical candidate for the repressing factor.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	211	 At this time, the identity of the repressing factor has not been definitely proven.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	212	 The EMSA results certainly hinted at an involvement of RP58; however, the cotransfection experiments with RP58 were inconclusive.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	213	 A possible explanation for these results is that the recombinant human RP58 used was indeed able to bind to the recognition sequence within the bovine promoter, but not to exert its repressing function in the heterologous bovine system.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	214	The influence of the PRNP promoter genotype with regard to the 23- and 12-bp indel polymorphisms on PRNP expression in vivo was further studied by qRT-PCR experiments.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	215	 We chose tissue samples from the spleen, brain stem, and intestinal lymph nodes because of their importance in the infection route of the prions.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	216	 The liver was chosen as a control organ because it is supposedly not involved in BSE pathogenesis.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	217	 Only the lymph nodes showed a significant distribution of the five genotype groups.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	218	 As the expression level of PRNP in intestinal lymph nodes was very low compared with that in the other organs, this result raises the intriguing question of whether the low PRNP amounts in intestinal lymph nodes are rate-limiting for the conversion of cellular PrPc into PrPSc during the spread of BSE infection toward the central nervous system.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	219	 The higher expression level of the pDelDel plasmid is consistent with our previous finding that the 23del:12del genotype is associated with higher susceptibility to BSE in German cattle (1).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	220	Our results tentatively indicate that individuals with deletion alleles at the 23-bp indel polymorphism have higher PRNP expression levels in their intestinal lymph nodes.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	221	 The influence of the promoter polymorphism on the expression levels is rather limited in comparison with the observed variance.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	222	 This might be because we analyzed whole tissue samples, which may have been composed of varying proportions of different cell types.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	223	 Future analyses should be performed at the single cell level, e.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	224	 by in situ hybridizations, as it has previously been demonstrated that PRNP expression is not completely uniform within lymph nodes (32).
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	225	 Despite the large variance, the observed differences in PRNP expression levels are consistent with the notion that the 23-bp deletion allele is associated with higher susceptibility to BSE in German cattle.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	226	In conclusion, we have shown that two indel polymorphisms in the bovine PRNP promoter that contain binding sites for the RP58 and SP1 transcription factors modulate the expression level of PRNP in vitro.
0.34315994.16141216.html.plaintext.txt	227	 Our in vivo data show that the PRNP genotype may contribute to the observed high variance of PRNP expression in intestinal lymph nodes.
